body: As I understood, we need mitmproxy to change focus, when we click **exactly** on the headers(Flows, Events), not on the other places of a tab? Am I correct?

I had the circled area in mind, but I can be convinced for something else :)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1019198/34447184-d3c1dadc-ece1-11e7-8c73-ffada6a016bb.png)

issue.title: console: shift+tab is broken in WSL for some Windows terminals

repository.name: mitmproxy
repository.description: An interactive TLS-capable intercepting HTTP proxy for penetration testers and software developers.

issue.body:
See https://github.com/Microsoft/WSL/issues/1770. This seems to affect some but not all Windows terminals. 

We use shift+tab by default to switch to the next pane in the console app. We can:

- Say that this is not our problem, and wait for upstream to fix it.
- Find a different binding for next pane - which would be a shame, because shit+tab is very natural.

@mhils what say you?

body:
What about this? 
![2017-12-31 18-16-56](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20267977/34462938-cfa56448-ee56-11e7-9149-19dde5eaa6ed.png)
Can we switch between "Key Bindings" - "Filter Expressions" tabs, while focusing on "Events"? 
We can still do it now.
If the events pane is focused, we shouldn't be able to modify stuff in the Help pane by pressing keys. So yes, this looks like a (related) bug.
@mhils So, do we need to open new issue or leave this bug for current issue?

@kajojify: This may have been a misunderstanding. If I have the events pane focused as in your example, pressing "tab" (or any other key) does not switch the tab in the left pane. How do you switch between tabs while focusing the right pane?

@mhils by pressing left button of mouse. It is possible because of mitmproxy/tools/console/tabs.py
https://github.com/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/blob/master/mitmproxy/tools/console/tabs.py#L17

issue.title: Bugs with console fixed.

repository.name: mitmproxy
repository.description: An interactive TLS-capable intercepting HTTP proxy for penetration testers and software developers.

issue.body:
- Clicking on tab head focuses a tab now. #2676 fixed.
- We can't click on different stuff in not focused tab by pressing left button of mouse now. #2738 fixed.
